results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.

results.brief_description:

Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and records how the staff of a regional technical school respond to the attitude problems of Year 9 students.

results.title: Science needs girls too
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program featuring Leonie Gianetto, Ursula Groves and Ann Osman from the McClintock Collective and students from Swinburne Community School and Swinburne Technical School who examine ways in which girls can be encouraged to take a more active part in the sciences.

results.title: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Looks at the International Fellowship Scheme which operates in Victoria. Highlights the professional development aspects of the project, the influence visiting participants have on school communities and the input gained by schools upon the return of Victorian recipients. Featured speakers include: Rex Murfett, Susan Gianevsky, Richard Wood, Alex McKnight and Kevin Collins.

results.title: Sexual harassment in schools
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program looks at some examples of sexual harassment in a school setting. Focuses on the consequences of harassing behaviour and avenues available to people who wish to take action to prevent it continuing. Ways of dealing with such incidences are suggested and legal rights under the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 are explained.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Bob Scarfe, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.title: Computers as Work Aids in Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert in the field discusses the rise of computers as work aids in transport, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne Oct.16-18,1980

results.title: Circus nomads
results.creator_credit: David Hughes, Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film aims to portray the circus as a nomadic way of life, to give viewers a deeper insight into aspects of circus life, and to show the circus as a form of theatre where the clown is king.
